title.narrative: Ramaad - environment relief project in Somalia

description.narrative: Ramaad is a joint project executed by the Finnish Somalia Network with its partners addressing the conservation of the environment in Somalia subject to threat due to desertification caused particularly by the cutting of trees for charcoal. Ramaad is the s econd environmental joint project of the Network and will be implemented at 3 sites in South-Central Somalia in cooperation with network's three partners from Finland and their three partners in Somalia. The innovative cooperative model enforces the civil society in Somalia addresses environmental problems and creates new networks.The Finnish Somalia Network draws from the experience that the ongoing Sahansaho joint project has brought. The new project utilizes the results resources and infrastructure built in the Sahansaho project especially the environment protection centre in Adado Central Somalia. At the same time however Ramaad will introduce also new elements in combatting desertification. The long-term objective is to enhance sustainable development of the environment empower local people and to reduce extreme poverty. The objectives are to be reached through a long term project (1 + 3 + 3 years). In line with the announcement of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs the Finnish Somalia Network is now appl ying for funding for the first phase which is a 1-year period of launching and focusing the plan for the continuation of the project. The activities of the first phase are:- a field study and a joint meeting of all the partners which will produce informati on needed for the focusing of the plan for the coming 3 + 3 year project- awareness raising seminars to local communities- training about tree planting and seedling techniques- experimenting with energy saving stoves an alternative source of energy and inc ome instead of charcoal trading- establishing a support group of the project at each site including different local actors- preparing the construction of environmental protection centres e.g. construction plans for centres and agreements regarding the land use with local administration- familiarizing partners with the joint project administrative and reporting practices and creating good collaborationIn the continuation of the project the activities include establishing environment protection centres at each site planting trees training local communities about desertification introducing of energy saving stoves training volunteers in tree planting.
